Hygiene kits will also be available if your children are in need of daily essentials.

We are in need of substitute teacher’s aides for our district. All that is required is a love of children, the ability to follow directives, get along with others and to have a valid Teacher’s Aide Permit through ODE.

To apply for a Permit you will need:

A completed application for Paulding Schools
FBI/BCI Background Check ($60 non-refundable)
ESEA Qualification - Only 1 item below is required
* Associates Degree
* 2 years of post-secondary coursework
* ParaProfessional Exam ($100 non-refundable)

Teacher Aides help in the High School, Middle School, Oakwood Elementary, and Paulding Elementary including the preschool programs in both of the elementaries.

Contact Cindy Kauser at c_kauser@pauldingschools.org or 419-399-4656 ext 1512, for more information or questions on the application process.

post_text: The Paulding High School Science Olympiad team placed 6th at the Northwest Ohio Regional competition at BGSU on Saturday, March 17. This qualifies them for State competition in Columbus in April. Congratulations to the whole team. Team members include: Alli Reineck, Michael Kohart, Molly Adams, Courtney Luderman, Hannah Vance, Ethan Matty, Brian Matson, Isaac Smalley, Joseph Reineck, Charles Clapsaddle, Sadie Estle, (and MaryCate Panico not pictured.)
